oai_dc:dc.dc:title: CHANGING OF WAVE CLIMATE DUE TO BREAKING ON A TIDAL INLET BAR
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Niemeyer, Hanz Dieter
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: tidal inlet
wave breaking
wave climate
inlet bar
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Changes of wave climate due to breaking on a tidal inlet bar are investigated by analysis of field measurements prosecuted offshore and onshore of the bar. Quantitative results for wave height reduction, period and length transformation and energy dissipation are presented as well as a study considering the dominating breaking criterion.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 20 (1986): Proceedings of 20th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Taipei, Taiwan, 1986.; 105
